page.title: 16A COSHESTON WIFE'S DAY
page.content: I usually get up at 7.30,make the breakfast and take my children to school, one to the comprehensive school in Pembroke,the other to the village school.Then I start cleaning the house.Most Cosheston wives have washing machines,tumble driers and vacuum cleaners to help them.Nearly everyone in the village has a car,because without one,life would be difficult for shopping.The only bus service is the school bus. I have a break at lunchtime after which I drive to Pembroke Dock for my shopping.Then I pick the children up from school and cook the evening meal.There is not much to do in the village but in the evenings we either watch T.V. or go to the pub for a quiet drink.I usually go to bed at about 10.30pm.
